title: Life Without Light: Creatures in the Dark With Sarah McAnulty

last_post.content:
In the dark deep sea, sperm whales use echolocation to find food.

Their echolocation clicks are *loud*. 230 decibels loud. How loud is that? Well, loud enough that if a sound wave of 230 decibels hit ya, you'd be dead 😳

Want to learn more about how animals live in the dark?
👀

You do?? Well you're in luck because I'm teaching a class this summer starting June 20th that's all about Life in the Dark.

I'm rabies vaccinated. Let's go.

4 weeks, $75
https://www.atlasobscura.com/experiences/nocturnal-animals-course

title: St. Francis - Brother Sun, Sister Moon - The Conversion Scene

last_post.content:
I need to pick a time this #Lent to re-watch #BrotherSunSisterMoon, about the life of #StFrancisOfAssissi. You can watch the conversion scene here, where he rejects his life in a wealthy, respected family to wander off and live outside the village: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ev2d92_W47Y

St Francis represents some of the best fundamentalism I've seen come out of Christianity: reject hierarchical social orders, live a simple life, free yourself from social constructs, and try to live in the natural splendor of creation, as the animals do.

title: Who chooses the number of sides of a market?

last_post.content:
The EU's biggest telecoms have gotten the European Commission to start a proceeding about forcing online sites and services to pay every ISP, pretending that online video is SO expensive for the telcos (it's not).

Now EU giant Telefonica rips off the mask, and in a blog post, calls for ending #netneutrality and says ISPs should be a two-sided market. That means ISPs get to demand payment from any and all sites, and block any site that won't pay.

It's entreprenurial!

https://www.telefonica.com/en/communication-room/blog/who-chooses-the-number-of-sides-of-a-market/

last_post.content:
We’ll miss you, Lance Reddick.

Iconic star of The Wire, John Wick, Lost, Fringe, the video games Destiny and Horizon Zero Dawn, and the face of countless other roles, TMZ reports (with Variety confirming) that legendary actor Lance Reddick has died at age 60.

title: FTC Finalizes Order Requiring Fortnite maker Epic Games to Pay $245 Million for Tricking Users into Making Unwanted Charges

last_post.content:
Epic Games must refund $245 million to consumers because it used dark patterns that led consumers to make unintended in-game purchases.

It is interesting to note that Epic Games were essentially fined for making use of evil user interface design.

I think that is a really intriguing point – and it demonstrates that design has a tremendous responsibility. Not only in terms of aesthetics and usability – but also in a legal sense.

last_post.content:
I spent several hours reading through this still-in-progress #InteractiveFiction forum thread, driven by Daniel Stelzer, playing 1995's "Jigsaw". https://intfiction.org/t/lets-play-jigsaw/59520

I loved this game, and sunk a weekend or two immersed in the brand-new text adventure before my final year at university pulled me away, leaving my progress forever unfinished.

What a joy to revisit familiar places—including the puzzle I got stuck on (the *mandolin*? oy)—and to see so much fresh exploration and discussion.
